## Ponder

::: {.callout-note}
## ğŸ¤”

**From Building Blocks to Network Structure**

Reflect on how dyadic and triadic patterns aggregate to form larger network structures:

- **Dyadic reciprocity**: Why do some networks have high reciprocity while others don't? What does this reveal about relationship formation?
- **Triadic closure**: How does the principle "friends of friends become friends" shape network evolution? When might this principle fail?
- **Network dynamics**: How do local interaction patterns (dyads and triads) create emergent global network properties?

Consider examples: professional networks (weak reciprocity, strategic triads), romantic relationships (high reciprocity, exclusive triads), or collaboration networks (project-based triads).

**Further Reading**:

- **Dyadic and Triadic Structure**: Chapters 13-14 from Wasserman & Faust (1994), [Social Network Analysis](https://go.exlibris.link/rW0j0hZX)
- **Applied Analysis with R**: Chapter 7 from Rawlings et al. (2023), [Network Analysis with R](https://inarwhal.github.io/NetworkAnalysisR-book/)
- **Random Graph Models**: Chapter 33 from Levey et al. (2024), [The Sage Handbook of Social Network Analysis](https://go.exlibris.link/xdR3Hpkn)
- **Network Dynamics**: Chapter 34 from McLevey et al. (2024), [The Sage Handbook of Social Network Analysis](https://go.exlibris.link/xdR3Hpkn)
